com.vectorprint.configuration

Interface Configurable<P extends Map>

  • Type Parameters:
    P - a Map holding settings for the Configurable Object

    public interface Configurable<P extends Map>
    A Configurable object should be initialized by a SettingsProvider. Instead of implementing this interface to provide settings to your objects you could also make use of Setting, SettingsField and SettingsAnnotationProcessor.
    Author:
    Eduard Drenth at VectorPrint.nl
    See Also:
    FindableProperties, SettingsField

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <TYPE> TYPE getSetting(TYPE defaultValue, Class<TYPE> clazz, Object... keys)
      return a setting of a certain type
      P getSettings()
      return properties
      void initSettings(P settings)
      A settingsprovider can provide settings to a Configurable by calling this method.
